thread.title: Rugby Live Scoring: Sunwolves vs Hurricanes
thread.title_full: Rugby Live Scoring: Sunwolves vs Hurricanes

title: Rugby Live Scoring: Sunwolves vs Hurricanes
text:
Commentary 0' 
Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the Super Rugby clash between the Sunwolves and the Hurricanes from the Prince Chichibu Memorial Stadium. 0' 
Sunwolves: 15 Riaan Viljoen, 14 Takaaki Nakazuru, 13 Timothy Lafaele, 12 Derek Carpenter, 11 Kenki Fukuoka, 10 Hikaru Tamura, 9 Keisuke Uchida, 8 Willem Britz, 7 Edward Quirk, 6 Malgene Ilaua, 5 Sam Wykes, 4 Liaki Moli, 3 Heiichiro Ito, 2 Shota Horie, 1 Masataka Mikami 0' 
Hurricanes: 15 Jordie Barrett, 14 Cory Jane, 13 Matt Proctor, 12 Ngani Laumape, 11 Julian Savea, 10 Otere Black, 9 TJ Perenara (c), 8 Blade Thomson, 7 Ardie Savea, 6 Brad Shields, 5 Michael Fatialofa, 4 James Blackwell, 3 Jeffery To?omaga-Allen, 2 Ricky Riccitelli, 1 Chris Eves 0' 
Hurricanes have won their last matches in the Super Rugby competition whereas Sunwolves have lost their last five games. Hurricanes are the defending champions. 0' 
Egon Seconds is the referee today with Marius van der Westhuizen and Akihisa Aso assisting him. Minoru Fuji is the TMO. 0' 
Tiatia, the Sunwolves coach, has made many changes to the Sunwolves with new half-backs, new tight fives and new faces in the backline too. Liaki Moli starts in the second row instead of playing the blindside flanker. 0' 
Scrum-half TJ Perenara will captain the side in absence of Coles. Jeffery To'omaga-Allen and Chris Eves will be the props for the game. Jordie Barrett is going to make his debut at full-back, this is his first time playing in Japan. 0' 
Milner-Skudder is ruled out of this game because of a hamstring injury. Team Line-ups
